alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 24 at 7:33PM CST until further notice by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Mississippi, including the following county, Jackson. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 733 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ocean Springs, Moss Point, Escatawpa, Gautier, Helena, Hickory Hills, Vancleave, Big Point, Wade, Hurley, Gulf Park Estates and Gulf Hills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
